alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:04PM EST until January 11 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, Water enter yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 17.6 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 02/13/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tonight.
